title: IMAPで接続ができない
creator: ms.0908
content: 本件はIMAPでMicrosoft365アカウントをサインインしようとしたときに発生している事象です。 最初のユーザー追加画面で氏名とメールアドレスを入力します。 その後、メールアカウントの種類を選択する画面でIMAPを選択して「続ける」をクリックしても「設定を検証できませんでした。ユーザー名とパスワードが正しい場合は、サーバー管理者があなたの選択した設定を無効化している可能性があります。別のプロトコルを選択してみてください。」と表示され追加ができません。 上記メールアカウント選択画面で「設定を編集」をクリックしても結果は同様ですが、「詳細設定」→「テスト」をクリックすると、「次のアカウント設定が、指定されたサーバーを調べることにより見つかりました: 」と表示はされます。 しかし、続けようとすると「受信サーバーの設定がすでに存在しています。」と表示されてしまいます。 なお、Exchangeを選択した場合は追加できます。 Microsoft365アカウントについてはIMAPを有効化していますのでアクセスがブロックされているわけではないと考えています。 解決策を教えてください。
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/142.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Manage Identity with gmail
creator: Nocton
content: I have been setting up laptop for a local sports club. The underlying email account is a gmail account and I have used Manage Identities to set it up so that by default emails show as coming from the club's domain-related account, e.g. manager@sportsclub.uk. All seems OK; however, the email one receives from the account shows the correct signature, but still as coming from the gmail account Curiously though, if one hovers over the email address it shows the name of the 'manager identity' even though the display shows the name of the underlying gmail account. Everything is set up exactly as I have in my personal Thunderbird account which has several identities and all work as expected. The only difference is that my email account is a Plusnet one. So I assume that it must be a feature of gmail. Does anyone know if that is the case and what one can do about it?

title: Importing pst file from Mailstore
creator: bobfound
content:
I gave up on Outlook after a zillion years using it. When I reset my O/S (win11) I had to reinstall Outlook from Office, all paid up and legal. Nothing but problems trying to get my backed up PST file from previous Outlook. System kept trying to get me to subscribe to Windows 365 crap. I had standalone 2024 version of office. When I installed Thunderbird (I have it on laptops and other computers), I entered my email and voila, in about 1 minute I was sending and receiving emails. I had spent 6 hours on Outlook, even using AI (Copilot) to help me. I was SO IMPRESSED, that for once I donated to Thunderbird, $30 CAD.

Now, I used Mailstore to get my pst file, something I could NOT GET OUTLOOK to do, and have it available to export to Thunderbird, or for TBird to IMPORT from the pst. Neither one worked, telling me that TBird didn't have a profile for the transfer, or some such notation.

Any help would be appreciated. Like many of you, my whole communication life is in those emails (I have about 40 folders where I saved stuff).
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/143.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: Thunderbird does not accept Dutch Ziggo server settings anymore
creator: blousfrank
content:
Hello to you all, ,

Since 2016 I have linked my email address at Dutch Internet Service Provider to the Thunderbird email editor. In 2008 the ISP called @Home here in The Netherlands was taken over and was merged into the Ziggo Internet Service Provider. Since then it is called Ziggo mail.

Since Sunday 30 November Thunderbird (version 140.5.0esr) does not receive email anymore, nor sends them. Until that date, the program worked for 9 years practically flawlessly.

After I have removed the mentioned email account, I have set up the following:

Server settings: server type: IMAP mail server server name: imap.ziggo.nl port 993 (which is default) connection security: SSL/TLS authentication method: normal password

Outgoing server: server name smtp.ziggo.nl port: 465 (which is default) connection security: SSL/TLS authentication method: normal password

Now I receive the following error message: "Thunderbird failed to find the settings for your email account."

When I try to send a test email, the following error pops up: "The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) smpt.ziggo.nl failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections.

Are the "advanced account settings" also relevant? For example the IMAP server directory name.

Ziggo also provides a webmail, with URL webmail.ziggo.nl If I put the URL in F i r e f o x , it gives the following error message:

"403 ERROR The request could not be satisfied. This distribution is not configured to allow the HTTP request method that was used for this request. The distribution supports only cachable requests. We can't connect to the server for this app or website at this time. There might be too much traffic or a configuration error. Try again later, or contact the app or website owner. If you provide content to customers through CloudFront, you can find steps to troubleshoot and help prevent this error by reviewing the CloudFront documentation.

Generated by cloudfront (CloudFront) Request ID: IXC-KKQ0RjBwHkQg7AEIbncYTuNgq4R7NGFlIl_G0HwzCvtQ2Nk78g==

So far that error message.

The webmail of Ziggo however works in the Chrome browser and there I can see all my email that are saved on their server.

Do you have a suggestion how to make Thunderbird work again?

ISP Ziggo themselves say that my email address works. They can not provide any further assistance.

Kind regards,

Frank Blous The Netherlands
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:145.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/145.0;solver_id:2041068
